name: TheAtlantic
text: “There’s almost no importance in talking about record-breaking events anymore, when talking about fires in California,” a climate scientist tells @yayitsrob, “because we’ve broken all the records so many times that … what do they even mean anymore?” https://t.co/7zHzW15HAV

name: TheAtlantic
text: Because of the Electoral College, "Biden has no incentive to run up his margin in three reliably blue states" @PeterBeinart writes. "Instead, he’s singularly focused on purple ones in the Midwest." https://t.co/E7n466dXtx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Just as today we say the names of the many who have been unjustly killed by police officers, the names of those four girls became part of the call for change that energized social protests in the 1960s," Freeman A. Hrabowski III writes: https://t.co/AX7d0w4Y86

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the past four years, Britain has struggled against the heft of the EU as it seeks a new relationship with the bloc. The upshot is that London is now staring at a diplomatic defeat that would have seemed almost unimaginable before, writes @tommctague. https://t.co/v3nMtWMz4H

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bunkers let you believe what you want to believe, and comfort yourself against the horrors of that belief, alone and underground, @AnnieLowrey reports. Business is booming. https://t.co/7aCJLClEAh

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This president is different; the rules are different; and if it doesn’t adapt, fast, the press will stand as yet another institution that failed in a moment of crucial pressure," @JamesFallows writes: https://t.co/LMj5Vfeuaq

name: TheAtlantic
text: Only a few days left until #TheAtlanticFest 2020, featuring guests like Bill Gates, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, and many more. Join us for an exploration of what the United States has faced, and what we will become: https://t.co/Ri8NkZCjiA https://t.co/1z9NCYBkGr

name: TheAtlantic
text: Every day, @megangarber writes, the most watched shows of the country’s most watched news network take the idioms of American democracy and wear away at their common meanings. https://t.co/MteXW4KA5L

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sufjan Stevens was once known for mythologizing America. Now he’s dreaming about breaking up the country. The singer tells @skornhaber about his “political and bossy and bitchy” new album, “The Ascension.” https://t.co/StwDJskb8B

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Oddly, the White House has expressed practically no interest in supercharging the economic engine that could drive the president to victory," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/1o5MVnjfwG

name: TheAtlantic
text: The western wildfires reach national political salience. What took so long? Then: Is it just you or is everything sold out? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/uTczyMJxST

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the past two years, @KristinaRizga traversed the country for @TheAtlantic's "On Teaching" project, talking to veteran educators about their craft. Here's what she learned: https://t.co/UaalFuOmMr

name: TheAtlantic
text: Coffee growers assumed that the deadly disease devastating their plants could not cross the Atlantic. They were wrong, @marynmck writes: https://t.co/vaEjymzvjx

name: TheAtlantic
text: South America's largest country has long been ruled by conspiracist thought—and now it's stronger than ever, @Vinncent reports: https://t.co/tFafs30R5E

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Scenes From the 2020 Tour de France - 34 photographs from the first 17 (of 20) stages of this year's cycling race, delayed more than 2 months by the pandemic. The Tour concludes in Paris on September 20. https://t.co/z3bd3UpV85 https://t.co/6mBsoS55Kn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: I love this piece by @kait_tiffany about TikTok and the validation of teenage girl culture. Girls are hilarious, talented, creative, and weird in ways that broader society rarely rewards or even acknowledges. But on TikTok, girl culture is everywhere: https://t.co/xWBboL020G

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @kait_tiffany: i wrote a little bit about moop, an anonymous tiktok teen who does nothing and has 2.5 million followers as well as dozens (maybe hundreds?) of dedicated fan pages 

https://t.co/ADptrbPWfh

name: TheAtlantic
text: There's nothing remarkable about Mooptopia's videos, and yet she's TikTok's latest big star. Teens are going viral faster than ever, reports @kait_tiffany, setting up the potential for bizarre consequences and new pressures: https://t.co/50rBCe750N

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: This year, #TheAtlanticFest is entirely virtual -- tune in to catch Anthony Fauci, Hillary Clinton and Bill Gates.

At 12pm EST on Sep 24, I'm talking to @TomMcTague and @anneapplebaum about America's place in the world.

Tickets are FREE. Register here: https://t.co/r3L5b6ZpVq https://t.co/E48qbSCRWn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @KristinaRizga: The pandemic has revealed that few professions are as essential for a functioning society and democracy as teaching. But what is good teaching—and what could we do to support it better in the future? https://t.co/Z2OYuAHr99

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: "The inability to see reality through the smudge of one’s own ideology is a national affliction. As a general rule, Americans pick sides first; the thinking comes second." https://t.co/ccriDcsuWm

name: TheAtlantic
text: The sublime post-pandemic period that so many are longing for will likely not arrive all at once, like a clock striking midnight on New Year’s Eve, @jpinsk writes. https://t.co/OYQCSub9hs

name: TheAtlantic
text: A Quinnipiac poll shows Republican Senator Lindsey Graham in a tie with Democrat Jaime Harrison. In May, @AdamHSays reported that the Trump administration’s bungled response to the coronavirus has helped Harrison’s campaign: https://t.co/fHKiZNp4um
